pyuppaal.iTools.buildCG

pyuppaal.iTools.buildCG.get_str_before(string: str, label: str)
Returns

the substring of ‘string’ before the first occurrence of ‘label’.

If ‘label’ doesn’t exist in ‘string’, raise error.

pyuppaal.iTools.buildCG.get_str_after(string, label)
Returns

the substring of ‘string’ after the first occurence of ‘label’.

If ‘label’ doesn’t exist in ‘string’, raise error.

class pyuppaal.iTools.buildCG.Node(name, temp_name, sig_in, sig_out)

Bases: object

A instance of a Xml Template.

Parameters

  • strname – the name of the instance

  • temp_name (str) – the name of the template

  • sig_in (list) – a list of names of signals enter the node

  • sig_out (list) – a list of names of signals sent by the node

class pyuppaal.iTools.buildCG.XmlTemplate(code)

Bases: object

Used to define a template in the xml. Input is the corresponding code in the xml. :param str name: name of the template :param list sig_in: a list of signals enter the template :param list sig_out: a list of signals sent by the template :param dict params: relate input signal variable with its index in the input arguments

init_name()

Get the name from self.code

get_all_sync()

Using label “synchronisation” to find all signal names used in the template.

get_param()

Find the signal variables that come in through input.

And store the name of them with their index in the input arguments, which can be used to find the actual signal variable when give input argument.

get_instance(name, para_string)

Return and initialize an instance of the template using the input argument.

Parameters

  • name (str) – name of the new instance

  • para_string (str) – code of the input argument

class pyuppaal.iTools.buildCG.XmlReader(filename)

Bases: object

Used to read the xml file and take advantage of classes defined above.

init_template()

Find all templates in the code and init a ‘XmlTemplate’ for each of them.

get_notes()

By reading the ‘system’ part in the xml to init all time-automata instances. :return: a list fo ‘Node’.

pyuppaal.iTools.buildCG.add_edge(a, b, label='')
pyuppaal.iTools.buildCG.build_cg_code(nodes)

Given a list of ‘Node’, build the CG graph and print the markdown code.

pyuppaal.iTools.buildCG.build_cg(filename)

pyuppaal.iTools.ufactory

class pyuppaal.iTools.ufactory.UFactory

Bases: object

Generate xml elements of Uppaal, like declaration, query, queries, location, transition, template and so on.

>>> UFactory.function(queryTest)
static queries(queries: List[str])
Parameters

query (List[str]) – verification statements

>>> <queries>
>>>     <query>
>>>         <formula>E&lt;&gt; Output.pass</formula>
>>>         <comment />
>>>     </query>
>>>     <query>
>>>         <formula>E&lt;&gt; Output2.pass</formula>
>>>         <comment />
>>>     </query>
>>> </queries>
static declaration(declaration: str) → Element

Generate the declararion of UPPAAL.

Parameters

declaration (str) – all contents of declaration

static location(location_id: int, pos_x: int, pos_y: int, inv: Optional[str] = None, name: Optional[str] = None, is_committed: bool = False)

Generate a location

Parameters

  • id (int) – the id of location

  • pos_x,pos_y (int) – the position of location

  • inv (str) – theinvariant of location, e.g., gclk<=10 and gclk<100.

  • name (str) – the name of location

  • is_committed (bool) – determine whether it is committed or not

>>> <location id="id37" x="-169" y="-59">
>>>     <name x="90" y="166">pass</name>
>>>     <label kind="invariant" x="-212" y="-42">gclk&lt;=122</label>
>>>     <committed/>
>>> </location>
static transition(sourceID: int, targetID: int, pos_x: int, pos_y: int, guard: Optional[str] = None, sync: Optional[str] = None, clock_reset: Optional[str] = None, nail: bool = False)
Parameters

  • sourceID (int) – the id of start

  • targetID (int) – the id of end

  • post_x,post_y (int) – the position of sign

  • guard (str) – the guard of the edge, e.g., t>=10, t>100

  • sync (str) – the signal of synchronisation, e.g., ! and ?

  • clock_reset (str) – e.g., t=0

  • nail (bool) – determine whether the edge is curved

>>> <transition>
>>>     <source ref="id7"/>
>>>     <target ref="id6"/>
>>>     <label kind="guard" x="139" y="90">t&gt;=tERPMin</label>
>>>     <label kind="synchronisation" x="123" y="90">sync?</label>
>>>     <label kind="assignment" x="156" y="107">t=0</label>
>>> </transition>
static template(name: str, locations: List[Element], init_id: int, transitions: List[Element], parameter: Optional[str] = None, declaration: Optional[str] = None)
Parameters

  • name (str) – the name of template

  • locations (List[ET.Element]) – series of locations generated by UFactory.construct_location()

  • init_id (int) – the id of initial location

  • transitions (List[ET.Element]) – series of transitions generated by UFactory.construct_location()

  • parameter (str) – parameter instruction, e.g., <parameter>broadcast chan &amp;actNode, actPath,int tERPMin, int tERPMax</parameter>

  • declaration (str) – declaration instruction, e.g., <declaration>clock t;</declaration>

>>> <template>
>>>     <name>NodeN</name>
>>>     <parameter>broadcast chan &amp;actNode, int tERPMin, int tERPMax</parameter>
>>>     <declaration>clock t;</declaration>
>>>     <location> </location>
>>>     <location> </location>
>>>     <location> </location>
>>>     <init ref="id47"/>
>>>     <transition> </transition>
>>>     <transition> </transition>
>>>     <transition></transition>
>>> </template>
static input(input_name: str, signals: List[Tuple[str, str, str]], init_id: int)

Generate a linear model of input.

Parameters

  • input_name (str) – the name of input

  • init_id (int) – int, set the minimum <init ref=’xxx’/> of monitor

Parama List[Tuple[str, int, int]] signals

this data type is updated in umodel.TymedActions

static monitor(monitor_name: str, signals: List[Tuple[str, str, str]], observe_action: List[str], init_id: int, strict: bool = False, allpattern: bool = False)

Generate a new linear model of.

Parameters

  • monitor_name (str) – the name of monitor

  • signals (List[Tuple[str, int, int]]) – this data type is updated in umodel.TymedActions

  • init_id (int) – set the minimum <init ref=’xxx’/> of monitor

  • strict (bool) – determine whethe the observation is strict, which indicates other observations will be forbidden

>>> <template>
>>>     <name>Monitor</name>
>>>     <location> </location>
>>>     <location>init ref="id47"/>
>>>     <transition> </transition>
>>> </template>
